author: gcolvin
content:
I'd like to discuss here the notion of code safety I've been working with.  Do we agree that it is a good thing and worth having?

Simply put, I want to ensure that valid contracts will not halt with an exception unless they
* run out of gas, or
* overflow stack while making a recursive subroutine call.

The Yellow Paper defines five exceptional halting states.
1. Insufficient gas
2. More than 1024 stack items
3. Insufficient stack items
4. Invalid jump destination
5. Invalid instruction

So  states 1 (out-of-gas) and many of 2 (recursive stack overflows) will halt at runtime, the rest can be caught at validation time, including stack overflows not due to recursion.
